data.title: Atbash Encryption
data.solution:
n = int(input())
decoded_word = ''
for i in range(n):
    encoded_word = input()
    k = list(map(int, encoded_word.split()))
    for j in k:
        decoded_word += chr(ord('z')+ord('a')-j)
    decoded_word += ' '

print(decoded_word[:-1])
data.statement:
You are given a series of integers (ASCII values) separated by whitespace. You need to <<decode the hidden message>>. 
<<Each line>> of input represents <<one word.>>

[[Encryption Pattern:]]
<<1.>>  The values given are ASCII values, so convert them into a letter.
<<2.>>  The letters are <<Atbash>> encoded (meaning each letter equals to its mirrored counterpart) so convert them appropriately i.e.`a -> z` `b -> y ` `c -> x ` `d -> w`

testCases.testOut: half a century ago more time was spent on the preparation of meals despite them mostly having been made from rather simple and unexotic recipes whereas nowadays we treat the consumption of food as cultural and sensory overloads whilst simultaneously being unwilling to invest enough time to cook resulting in the rise of take aways and ready meals

testCases.title: Maximal text
testCases.testOut: the most perplexing aspect about the raised concerns however is their tardiness as they are somewhat reminiscent of the infamous experiment about how a frog will not resist being boiled alive as long as the water was set at a pleasant initial temperature if one had looked with an eagles eye on the effects of excessive consumption mere eight decades ago one would have inevitably conceded that our transformation to homines economici would have had detrimental effects on the further societal development as the innate qualities that make us human are being violated and radically distorted to fit us into

data.constraints:
1 <= [[N]] <= 100
All of the letters in question are <<lowercase letters.>>

<<Next [[N]] Lines:>> [[ASCII]] values separated by whitespace that need to be decoded into letters according to the [[Encryption Pattern]] described above. Per line, one word needs to be decoded.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given a series of integers (ASCII values) separated by whitespace. You need to decode the hidden message.
Each line of input represents one word.

Encryption Pattern:
1. The values given are ASCII values, so convert them into a letter.
2. The letters are Atbash encoded (meaning each letter equals to its mirrored counterpart) so convert them appropriately i.e.
a -> z
b -> y 
c -> x 
d -> w
Input
Line 1: How many words need to be decoded
Next N Lines: ASCII values separated by whitespace that need to be decoded into letters according to the Encryption Pattern described above. Per line, one word needs to be decoded.
Output
One line: The decoded words. They should be output in the same order as the input, however, each word ought to be separated by one whitespace.
Constraints
1 <= N <= 100
All of the letters in question are lowercase letters.
Example
Input
1
115 114
Output
hi
